en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
sna: Vapunduki Vanokakatira Kurutivi Vanotanga Hondo Inotyisa Kumaodzanyemba akaererekera kumabvazuva eNigeria
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
sna: Vapanduki vechi Islam chinokakatira kurutivi auraya vanhu vanomwe mukurwisa kwaitika kumaodzanyemba akadzvivira kumabvazuva mudunhu reBorno muNigeria, vakaona zvichiitika vakaudza Associated Press neChitatu
mt0: The militants killed seven people in a clash in the north-east of Borno, Nigeria, a source close to the scene told the AP on Wednesday.

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents.
sna: Vagari veko vakati vapanduki avavakarwisa musha weKautukari munzvimbo yeChibok iri mudunhu reBorno manheru eChipiri.
mt0: The villagers said they believe the rebels attacked the town of Kautukari in Chibok, Borno, on Tuesday night.

en: The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
sna: Kurwisa uku kwakaitika panguva imwe chete apo Munyori Mukuru weMubatanidzwa Wenyika Dzepasi Rese vaAntonio Gueterres mudunhu iri vachishanyira avo vakange vapukunyuka mhirizhonga yechi jihad iyi.
mt0: The attack took place at the same time as the United Nations Secretary General Antonio Gueterres was visiting the region to visit those who had escaped from the jihad.

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
sna: Nzvimbo yeChibok iri mufambo ungaite zana negumi nemashanu wemakiromita (kana kuti mamaira makumi manomwe nerimwe) kubva muguta guru redunhu reBorno, uko vaGuterres vakasangana nevakambenge vari vapanduki avo vava kudzoserwa zvakare kuti vagarisane nevamwe, uye vakaonana vezviuru zvevabhu vakabviswa kubva pavavaigara nekuda kwekupanduka uku.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know Chibok is about 150 km (77 mi) from Borno's capital, where Guterres met with former rebels who were reunited with others, and met with thousands of Aborigines who were evicted from their homes because of the revolt.

en: They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community, said Hassan Chibok, a community leader.
sna: Vakauya vakawanda uye vaine zvombo zvinesimba zhinji vakabva vatotora musha wedu kuuita wavo, vakadaro vaHassan Chibok mumwe wevakuru venzvimbo iyi.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
sna: Varwi vemumwe muzinda unogara mauto vakatumwa kunorwisana nekudzinga vapanduki ava, asi "vakange vaparadza nekutsokodzera kare,"vaChibok vakadaro, vachiwedzerawo kuti vakange vafa vakange vosvika gumi.

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
sna: mumwewo mugari wenzvimbo iyi, vaYana Galang vakati vanhu vanosvika vanomwe vakange vaurayiwa mukurwisa kwakapedzesera kuitika mauto ehurumende yeNigeria asati apindira. Asi mapurisa emuNigeria haana kutsinhidzira kuti kurwiswa uku kwakange kwaitika here kana kuti kwete.
mt0: One other resident of the area, Yana Galang, said that a total of seven people were killed in the fighting that continued until the Nigerian government intervened. But Nigerian police have not confirmed whether the fighting had taken place or not.

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province.
sna: Nigeria, iyo ine vagari vanosvika mamiriyonimazana mairi nematanhatu,ndiyo nyika ine vanhu vakawanda kudarika dzimwe nyika dzese muAfrica, inoramba ichitambura nekugadzirisa hondo yevapanduki iyo yava nemakore gumi ichipisa kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva eNigeria uko vapanduki vechi Isam vanokakatira kurutivi veBoko Haram nerimwe boka rakabuda kubva muvapanduki ava, reIslamic State of West Africa Province.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know Nigeria, which has a population of over 2 million, is the country with the largest population in Africa, which is fighting a decade-long armed conflict in the north-east of Nigeria where Boko Haram militants are fighting against Boko Haram and another group of militants, the Islamic State of West Africa Province.

en: The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
sna: Vapanduki ava varikurwisa kuti vamise mutemo wechi-Isam weSharia kuti ushandiswe uye kuti vadzivise nekumisa dzidziso yemuzvikoro yakabva kunyika dzevarungu dzekumavirazuva.
mt0: These rebels are trying to suppress the Sharia law to be used and to prevent the spread of the doctrine of the Eastern Europeans.

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
sna: Sangano reUN Development Program rinoti vanhu vanodarika zviuri makumi matatu nezvishanu vakapondwa, uye mamiriyoni mazhinji evagari vakabviswa mumisha yavaigara nemhirizhonga yakakozereswa nevapambuki vanokakatira kurutivi ava. Mukutanga kwesvondo rino, mutungamiriri weNigeria vaMuhammadu Buhari vakati hondo yekurwisa vapanduki ava yava"kuswedera kumagumo ayo," vachitaurawo pamusoro pekurohwa kwevapanduki nehondo yemuchadenga yeNigeria uyewo nezvekutiza kwevarwi vazhinji vachisiya vapanduki ava, avo vanonzi nevaongorori vezvenyaya iyi vavakukanda zvombo zvavo pasi nenyaya yekumukirana nekurwisana muboka revapanduki vejihad iri.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
sna: Mutungamiriri weNigeriamukutanga kwesvondo rino vakati hondo yekurwisa vapanduki vanokakatira kurutivi yava “kuswedera kumagumo ayo” vakapa muenzaniso kurohwa nepfuti dzemuchadenga nekutiza kuri kuita zviuru zvevarwi vachisiya bato iri, vamwe vacho varikunzi vava kukanda zvombo pasi nekuda kwekurwisana mukati mechikwata che jihadi ichi.
mt0: The Nigerian President said the fighting against the militants against the Islamic State was "close to its end" and gave examples of shootings and evacuations of thousands of soldiers from the group, some of whom are reported to be taking weapons from the group.

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
sna: Bonggozozo rekukuvadzana iri riri kuenderera mberi kumisha iri kumiganhu yenyika yeNigeria, uye nekunzvimbo dziri mujinga redhamu guru re Lake Chad, inova nzvimbo inoparutsigiro rwakawanda kuboka reISWAP, iro rinodyidzana nechikwata che Islamic State.
mt0: The violence is continuing in cities in the northern Nigerian region and in the southern Lake Chad region, which is a major support site for the ISWAP, a group affiliated with the Islamic State.

en: Things are getting worse in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
sna: zvinhu zviri kuramba zvichienda kumawere mumushaweKautukari kuChibok nenzvimbo dzakaipoteredza dzakadziva kumasango, vakadaro mukuru wenzvimbo iyi vaChibok, vachitiwo kuvapo kwevapanduki vanokakatira kurutivi ava pedyo nesango iri kuri kuwedzera pkuti kurwisana uku kutsviriridze.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know the situation is going towards the elderly in the slums of Chibok and the surrounding areas, said the chief of the area, Chibok, adding that the presence of militants fighting along the border is increasing the violence.

en: In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances.
sna: Muchinyorwa  chakabuda chemaonero arinoita mamiriro ezvinhu muSouth Sudan chavakaburitsa muna Gumiguru, sangano irirakati hurumendeirikutambudza nekushungurudza vanorwira kodzerodzevanhu,vatorivenhau andnemhuridzavo, vachikanganisa nekuganhura basa ravo nezvemari dzavo.
mt0: In a report published in August, the organization said the government was abusing and killing journalists and their families, while taking advantage of their jobs and their money.

en: South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state, David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
sna: South Sudan ichiri iine basa zhinji rekuita kutiimise nekusimbisa masangano nemapazi akakosha mukushanda mekufambira mberi kwe nyika yegutsaruzhinji, vakadaro vadavid Renz mukuru mumuzinda unomiririra nyika ye United statesmuSouth Sudan mumashoko avo akabuda musi weChipiri, umo vakatsinhidzirawo kuti nyika yeUSA inoshushikana zvikuru nemamiriro ekushaiwa kusununguka kwemasangano enhau muSouth Sudan.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know South Sudan has a lot of work to do to ensure and strengthen the organizations and departments critical to the development of the country's democratic society, said David Renz, the United States' representative in South Sudan, in a statement issued on Tuesday, which reiterated that the United States is concerned about the lack of freedom of press in South Sudan.

en: We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters, Renz said.
sna: "Takaona zvimwe zviteshi zvemaredhiyo emuno achimiswa kuita basa pamusoro petwunyaya twusina nemusorowese," vakadaro vaRenz.
mt0: "We saw some broadcast channels being forced to work on this without any explanation," Renz said.

en: "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
sna: "Uye tinozvizivawo kuti vashandi vanoita zvekutepfenyura pamasaisayi emaredhiyo, pamadzangaradzimu nepamadandemutande enhaurirano dzepamadariro esocial media avakutya kutaura zvavanenge vachida kutaura.
mt0: We also know that broadcasters on television, radio and social media are afraid to say what they want to say.

mt0: In Sudan, journalists working in the capital, Khartoum, say they are being threatened and intimidated by the government forces that took over the country and the country's territory on August 25.

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media.

en: That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum.

mt0: On March 16, Sudan's top officials took over the rights and broadcasts of Al Jazeera Live and closed its offices in the capital Khartoum.

en: A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security."
sna: Tsamba yakabva kubazi rezvekufambiswa kwemashoko muSudan ichienda kumukuru wenhepfenyuro ye Al Jazeera Television muSudan yakati chakakozeresa kuvharwa kwenhepfenyuro iyi kwaiva"kusabata basa nemazvo nehumhizha" uyewo nezvirongwa izvo "zvaikuvadza nekukanganisa zvido nezvis higher interests huvo zvikuru zvenyika uyewo kuchengetedzwa kwayo kubva kumhandu."
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. A letter from the Sudanese Communications Ministry which was sent to the head of Al Jazeera Television in Sudan said that the channel was "not working properly and efficiently" and that "the program was prejudicing and prejudicing the interests of the country's higher interests and its protection from enemy influence."

en: The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
sna: Nhepfenyuro iyi inemuzinda wavo muguta re-Doha kuUnited Arab Emirates rakatsoropodza kuvharwa kwechiteshi chayo muKhartoum nehurumende.
mt0: The broadcaster, based in Doha in the United Arab Emirates, has criticised the government's decision to close its office in Khartoum.

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
sna: Muna Kukadzi, vakuru vakuru vemuSudan vakasunga boka revatapi venhau vesangano renhau reBBC muguta reKhartoum ndokuvabvunzurudza kwemaawa akati kuti kwava kuzovaregedza vachienda.
mt0: In February, Sudanese officials took a group of journalists from the BBC in Khartoum and interrogated them for several hours, saying that they were going to be released.

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan went unanswered.
sna: Sangano renhau reVOA rakada kunzwa kuti hurumende yeSudan inoti kudii panyaya iyi, nhare yakaridzirwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja vanova mupi wemazano kumukuru wemauto arikutonga muSudan,  asi nhare idzi dzairira dzisina anodaira.

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
sna: Vakuru vakuru Vanotii Mauto EkuBurundi Anosvika Makumi Matatu Aive Pakati Pemasoja eAU Akaurayiwa Pavakarwiswa ne Al-Shabab.
mt0: What do the officials say? About 30 Burundian troops were killed when they were attacked by Al-Shabab.

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
sna: Mumwe mukuru wemuBurundi anoti mauto ekuBurundi anosvika makumi matatu akaurayiwa nevamwe makumi mairi akakuvadzwa musi weChipiri mukurwiswa kwakaitwa muzinda wemasoja eAfrican Union nevarwi veAl-Shababkuchamhende kwe  Pavakarwiswa ne Al-Shabab.
mt0: One official in Burundi says that a total of 30 Burundi troops were killed and 30 more wounded in the attack on the African Union headquarters in the northern Somalia town of Paak.

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds.
sna: Mukuru uyu akakumbira kuti asadomwe nezita rake nekuti haana mvumo yekutaura nevatapi venhau, akaudza vatori venhau veVOA yekuSomali kuti masoja anodarika gumi akafira panzvimbo yavakarwisirwa, vamwewo ndokuzofa nekuda kwemaronda avaive nawo.
mt0: The chief asked for anonymity because he had no authority to speak to journalists, and told Somalia's VOA that more than ten soldiers died in the attack, some of them from wounds.

en: He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
sna: Akatsinhidzirawo kuti kune mamwe masoja asati azivikanwa kuti aripi.
mt0: He also pointed out that there are some soldiers who are still not known.

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu.
sna: weAl-Shabab inoti yakauraya masoja anosvika zana nemakumi manomwe nevatatu payakarwisa kamba yemasoja eAU mumusha El-Baraf, iri makiromita angasvike zana nemakumimashanu kubva kumaodzanyemba eMogadishu.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know the Al-Shabab says it killed over 170 soldiers when it attacked the AU base in El-Baraf, a village about 100 km south of Mogadishu.

en: The casualty figure has not been independently verified.
sna: Huwandu hwevavakakuvara hausati hwaongororwa nenyanzvi dzisina divi ravakarerekera.
mt0: Return only the translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack.
sna: Mumwe munhu akanyevera VOA Somali kuti paive nemasoja zana nemakumi matanhatu nerimwe panguva paitwa kurwiswa uku. Mukuru wemuBurundian uyu akatsinhira kuti huwandu hwemauto hwakataurwa kuti aive mukamba ndowechokwadi.
mt0: One person told VOA Somali that there were hundreds of soldiers in the camp when the attack was carried out. The Burundian official confirmed that the number of soldiers reportedly in the camp was true.

en: The Burundian official confirmed that number.
sna: Mukuru wemuBurundian uyu akatsinhira kuti huwandu hwemauto hwakataurwa kuti aive mukamba ndowechokwadi.
mt0: The Burundian official confirmed that the number of troops reported to be in the camp was true.

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack.
sna: Mukuru wemuBurundi uyu akaudza VOA Somali kuti masoja akange anzwa runyerekupe rwekuti al-Shabab yakange yakaungana panemumwe musha waiva pedyo nekamba yavo kwemaawa angaite makumi mana nemasere kukrwiswa uku kusati kwaitika.
mt0: The official told VOA Somali that the troops had heard reports that al-Shabab had been gathering in a house near their camp for about a dozen hours before the attack.

en: He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
sna: Akatiwo masoja akange agadzirira kuzvichengetedza nekuzvirwira uye akange achera makomba ekuhwanda maari.
mt0: He also said that the soldiers were prepared to protect and defend him and were cutting off the barriers against him.

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp.
sna: Akaenderera mberi achiti chakashamisa masoja aya kwaiva kukura kwemabhomba e al-Shaba avakakanda akaputikira mukamba yavo.
mt0: He continued saying that what surprised the troops was the increase in the number of al-Shabab fighters who had entered their camp.

en: He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch.
sna: Akatizve varwi ava vakashandisa marori matatu kutakura mabhomba aya, imwe yemarori aya yakawira mugoma.
mt0: They also said they used three wagons to carry the bombs, one of which fell into the gorge.

en: He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
sna: Akafungidzira kuti varwi ava vakashandisa mabhomba ane huremu hwungasvike ma kilogramme makumi mairi uye varwi vakapinda mukamba iyi vachiyirwisa vaisvika mazana mana nemakumi mashanu.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
sna: Mukuru muhurumende uyu akati marori akange ane mabhaobhu nevanhu vakazvipira kuzviiputsitira mabhombu kuti vaurayewo vanhu ndizvo zvakakonzeresa kufa nekukuvara kuzhinji..
mt0: The official said that the riots were caused by the armed forces and the volunteers who wanted to kill people.

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured.
sna: Izvi zvisati zvazivikanwa, hurumende yeBurundi yakatura mashoko ekuti masoja avo gumi akange afa, paine vashanu vakange vashaikwa uye ne vamwe makumi maviri nemashanu vakange vakuvara.
mt0: Before this was known, the Burundian government announced that ten of its soldiers had died, with six missing and twenty-five injured.

en: Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
sna: Burundi yakatiwo makumi maviri evarwi ve al-Shabab vakange vaurayiwawo mukurwiswa uku.
mt0: Burundi says that 20 al-Shabab fighters were also killed in the attack.

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent.
sna: Padandemutande reTwitter,Mutungamiriri weBurundi, vaEvariste Ndayishimiye vakati vakuna mashoko akasimbarara angawaninikwe angatsoropodze nekushora kurwiswa kwakaitwa nemagandsanga uku.
mt0: On Twitter, Burundi's President, Evangelos Ndayishimiye, said he had no comment on the attack.

en: He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters to console the hard-hit families."
sna: Vakanyora kuti, "Ndinobatana pamwepo neAfrica yose iyo ichangorasikirwa ne vanakomana nevanasikana  mukunyaradza mhuri dzarwadziswa nechiitiko ichi."
mt0: "I am going to join all of the African families affected by this tragedy to help them." he wrote.

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
sna: Mubatanidzwa wenyika dzemuAfrica weAfrican Union, hurumende ye Somali nemuzinda unomiririra United States uri muMogadishu vose vashora zvakasimbisisa kurisa kwakaitwa ne al-Shabab uku.
mt0: The African Union, the Somali government and the United States embassy in Mogadishu all condemn the expansion of the violence by al-Shabab.

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
sna: Mukuru weAU vaMoussa Faki Mahamat vakapa kuremekedza kumauto eBurundian akafa aya, vakatiwo "kurwisa uku "kwakange kuzere chinya" hakuzoite kuti rutsigiro runopiwa varwi veAU vari kuSomalia rwuderere.
mt0: The AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian troops killed, saying that "the attack was "completely unprovoked" and that the support provided to the Somali forces would not be limited.

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
sna: Bazi rinoona nezvekudyidzana nedzimwe nyika muSomali rakakumbira nyika dzepasi rose riwedzere kupa goneso nezvombo zvepamusoro soro kuvarwi venyika yeSomali nemauto eAU kuti vanyarwisana nekupedza hugandanga muSomalia.
mt0: The Somali Foreign Affairs Office has asked the international community to provide more weapons and supplies to the Somali troops and the AU forces to fight against the violence in Somalia.

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
sna: Muzinda unomiririra US muMogadishu wakati unotumira mashoko ekunyaradza nekubata maoko kumhuri dzine masoja akaurayiwa nekushuvira kupora nekukasira kune vose vakakuvara.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
sna: Mukuru weguta reEl-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, wakaudza VOA kuti kurwisana kwakaitika pakamba yemasoja iyi ndiko kwaingekwakaipisisa kwati kwamboonekwa mugua mudunhu iri.
mt0: The mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that the fighting at the base of the army was the worst that has ever been seen in the region.

en: Fighting like this never happened in this area, he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
sna: Kurwisana kwakadai hakusati kwamboitika mudunhu rino, akadaro ndokuzoenederera mberi achiti kurwisana uku kwakange kwaurayawo vanhuwo zvavo vaviri nekukuvadzawo vamwe gumi. "Kwaiva kurwisana kwakadzama chaizvo."
mt0: "This is the first such a fight in the region," he said, adding that the fight had killed two people and wounded ten others. "It was a very fierce fight."

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
sna: Chiitiko ichi kwakava kurwiswa kwekutanga kukuru pamauto eAU anoshanda muEthiopia kubva zvakaashandura zita ravo nemamiriro ekushanda kwavo mwedzi wapera.
mt0: This was the first major attack on the AU forces operating in Ethiopia since they changed their name and their roles last month.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government.
sna: Bazi rinoona nezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyikamusangano renyika dzepasi rose re U.N. Security Council, iri rakapa mvumo yekuti kuve nebasa iri rekuchengetedza runyararo muSomalia rinonzi African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, rakaripa mutoro wekuderedza njodzi inobva kumagandanga evapanduki  e al-Shabab, vachipa rutsigiro negoneso kumauto emuSomalia uye kuzopa muzvidimbu masimba ekuchengetedza nyika kuhurumende yeSomalia dzamara yavakuita basa racho yega.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
sna: Basa reboka iri rinenge riripo kusvikira kumagumo egore ra2024.

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
sna: Kenya Yodzidzisa Vashandi Vemudzimba Vari kuMiddle East Nezvekodzero Dzavo
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
sna: Vakuru vemu Kenya vava kudzidzisa vashandi vekudzimba veko vatambira mabasa munyika dzemu Middle East pamusoro pekodzerodzavo mushure memakore ekutaurwa nezve kumbunyikidzwa kwekodzero ikoko, zvinosanganisira kurohwa, zvibharo nekupondwa.
mt0: Kenyan authorities are teaching workers in the Middle East about their rights after years of complaints about their rights, including murder, rape and murder.

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
sna: Rava gore kubva apo Bernard Njenga akazoziva kuti mudzimayi wake, Esther Thuku, akafira kuSaudi Arabia, uko akange ari mushandi wemumba kwemakore matatu.
mt0: It has been one year since Bernard Njenga discovered that his wife, Esther Thuku, died in Saudi Arabia, where he had been a housekeeper for three years.

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
sna: Vakuru vemuSaudi vakazivisa kuti mukazi wake  akange azviuraya pamba pevanhu vaayishandira, Njenga akadaro, asiakagutsikana kuti  mudzimai wake waive nevana vana akapondwa.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. Officials in Saudi Arabia announced that his wife had killed herself at the home of his colleagues, However, he was not happy that his wife had had her children murdered.

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself.
sna: Njenga akati muviri wedzimayi wake wakange usina mavanga ayiratidza kuti akange azvisungirira.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
sna: Akaendereramberi achiti zvairatidza sekunge chitunha ichi chakambofushirwa nekuti  chaive netsvina yakawanda uye zvaiita sekuti mukadzi wake wakange abayiwa nechinhu chinopinza parutive rweruboshwe.
mt0: He continued saying that it looked like the body had been wiped out because it was covered with a lot of urine and it looked like his wife had been struck by something.

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East.
sna: Vakuru vemu Kenya vanoti kubva munMbudzi achangodarika, vashandi vemumba vasiri pasi pemakumi maviri vevatatu vakafa vachishanda kuMiddle East.
mt0: Kenyan officials say that since November, no fewer than twenty-three workers have died while working in the Middle East.

en: Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
sna: Vanoshanda munezvekuwaniswa mabasa vanoti ruzhinji rwendufu idzi rwakaitika kuSaudi Arabia.
mt0: Employment officials say most of the attacks were in Saudi Arabia.

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
sna: Vakuru vemuSaudi vakazivisa kuti ndufu dzese dziri makumi maviri nenhatu dzakange dzakonzereswa nemwoyo yakangorega kushanda.
mt0: The Saudi authorities announced that all the twenty-six deaths had been caused by a heart attack.

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
sna: Muna Kubvumbi wegore ra2020, chikwata chinorwira kodzero dzevanhu cheAmnesty International chakaburitsa mashoko ekuti vanhu vekuKenya vanoshanda mudzimba kuMiddle East vanowanzogunun'una pamusoro pekusabhadharwa mihoro yavo, kumanikidzwa kuita basa,  kurohwa nekukuvadzwa muviri, kubatwa chibharo nekushandiswa mumamirirro ezvinhu nemunzvimbo dzine njodzi.
mt0: In April 2020, Amnesty International released a report that workers from Kenya working in housing in the Middle East are often complaining about their wages, being forced to work, being beaten and injured, being abused and being used in dangerous conditions and places.

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
sna: Iyezvino, Kenya yavakupa vanoda dzidziso yekuzvichengetedza kuvashandi vemudzimba vanotora mabasa kunze kwenyika.
mt0: Now, Kenya has provided workers with safety training for those who work abroad.

en: When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse, said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi.
sna: Kana usingavadzidzise,zvaunenge uchitoita, kuvarega vachipinda munjodzi huru yekubatirirwa nekumbunyikidzwa, akadaro muzvare Edith Murogo, mukuru weEast Africa Institute of Homecare Management muNairobi.
mt0: If you don't teach them, what you're doing, you're going to put them in a great danger of being persecuted and humiliated, said Edith Murogo, head of the East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi.

en: "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness.
sna: "Chikamu chedzidziso iyi chinosanganisira kuvaonesa nekuvajekesera nezvekodzero dzevashandi.
mt0: The part of this course involves teaching them the rights of employees.

en: They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
sna: Vanofanirwa kuti vazive  kuti vanotaurirana seyi nevashandi pamusoro pezvakanangana nemashandirwo ebasa nemihoro zvinechiremera."
mt0: They should know that they talk to workers about their work and pay levels."

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
sna: Vanhu vemuKenya vanosvika zviuru makumi matatu vanotamira kuMiddle East kuti vanotsvaga mabasa ikoko gore negore.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
sna: Gurukota rinoona nezvemabasa muhurumende yeKenya, vaSimon Chelugui, vakati bazi ravo riri kushanda nevakuru vekuSaudi kuti pave nekushandurwa mitemo yezvemabasa.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always, Chelugui said.
sna: Tinodawo kuti vakwidziridze mitemo yavo kuti ichengetedze vashandi nevashandirwi zvakaenzana, kwete kusarudza nekuva nemaonero ekuti mushandirwi ndiye arimugwara nhambo dzose,  Chelugui akadaro.
mt0: We want them to amend their laws to protect workers and employers equally, not to choose to believe that the employer is always sick, Chelugui said.

en: "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
sna: "Chechipiri ndechekuti mari inotambirwa ine mwero uye inoenderana nebasa riri kuita here."
mt0: The second is whether the amount of money being paid is appropriate and consistent with the work done.

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers.
sna: VOA yakabata muzinda weSaudi muNairobi kuti vanzwewo kuti vanoti kudii nekunenedzerwa kusabatwa zvakanaka nekufa kwevashandi vanobva kuKenya.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know VOA reached the Saudi embassy in Nairobi to hear what they think about the lack of a proper treatment of workers from Kenya.

en: In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
sna: Vachinyora mutsamba yepapotonjere muzinda uyu wakati, humambo hweSaudi Arabia hunoti hautunhidze nekupembedza kubata zvisiri kunze kwemutemo kana kushungurudza munhu upi zvake, wakatizve Saudi Arabia iri kushanda pamwe chete ne Kenya kuti vagari vave vakachengetedzwa kubva pakunetswa kupi zvako.
mt0: They wrote in a statement at the palace that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia does not support acts of violence or violence against any person, and that Saudi Arabia is working with Kenya to protect its citizens from any violence.

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
sna: Zvichakadai, vakuru vakuru vanoti, pane vanhu vachidiki vanofungidzirwa kuti vangasvike mamiriyoni maviri  vari kupedza makosi muzvikoro zvepamusoro gore rega rega, zvichibva paqkuhwerengedzwa kwehuvandu hwevanhu vakadai munyika yese, asi kuine mabasa evanhu vangasvike zviuru mazana masere zvinoreva kuti vanhu vazhinji vemuKenya vacharamba vachienda kunze kwenyika kunotsvaga mabasa.
mt0: However, officials say, there are approximately two million young people expected to complete courses in higher education each year, due to the decline in the number of such people in the country, but there are approximately 7,000 jobs available, meaning that many Kenyans will continue to leave the country to look for work.

en: South Africa Urges Africa's First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
sna: Vatapi Venhau MuEthiopia Vanoti Rusununguko Rwezvekutapwa Kwenhau Ruri 'Pamharadzano'
mt0: Ethiopian journalists say the freedom of reporting is "in the balance"

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
sna: Apo Mutungamiriri weEthiopia, vaAbiy Ahmed vakapinda muhofisi makore mana apfuura, Reporters Without Borders, sangano rekuParis rinorwira nekukurudzira kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau rakasimudzira chinzvimbo cheEthiopia nezvinhanho makumi mana pachikero chinoyera kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau pakati penyika dzepasi rose.
mt0: When President Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based organization that promotes and promotes the freedom of press, raised Ethiopia's position by fourteen places on the world press freedom rankings.

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state.
sna: Uku kwaiva kusvetukira kumberi kukuru mushure memakore mazhinji ekudzvinyiriewa kwezvekutorwa kwenhau nehurumende.
mt0: This was a significant advance after many years of government censorship.

en: But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
sna: Asi kubva pakatanga hondo pakati pemauto ehurumende yezvedunhu reTigray nevapanduki mukupera kwa2020, Ethiopia yakawira pasi zviyero zvekusunguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau.
mt0: However, since the start of the war between the Tigrayan government and rebels in the end of 2020, Ethiopia has fallen behind on the freedom of information broadcasting.

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
sna: Pakucherechedza Zuva Rekusununguka Kwezvekutapwa Kwenhau Pasi Rose muna2022, VOA yakataura nevatapi venhau vemuEthiopian pamusoro pekuti vanonzwa kuti vakasununguka kusvikira papi pamusoro pekuita basa ravo.

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.

mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. Elias Meseret, who has previously worked for the Associated Press, told VOA that the ethics of Ethiopian press freedom are under threat.

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
sna: Nhau Dzenhema, Kurambidzwa Kwekufambiswa Kwenhau Zvokonzeresa Kuderera Kwerusununguko Rwekutapwa Kwenhau Pasi Rose

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
sna: Zvichitungamirirwa nemucherechedzo weKremlin, kusimuka pasi rose kwenhau dzenhema nedzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzizere nemanyepo zviri kukanganisa zvikuru nhau dzakazvimiririra dzega dzisina rutivi rwadzakarerekera pasi rose, sekuonekwa kwazvakaitwa neongororo itsva yezvenhau ichangoburwa.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
sna: Muchikero cha2022 chekuongorora kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau munyika dzose dzepasi cheWorld Press Freedom Index chakaburitswa nemusi weChishanu boka reReporters Without Border iro rine muzinda waro muParis, rakati kupinda kweRussia  neganyavhu muUkraine kwakakonzeresa zvikuru kutekeshereswa kwenhau dzenhema nedzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzine manyepo.
mt0: In the 2022 World Press Freedom Index published on Thursday, the group Reporters Without Borders, which has its headquarters in Paris, said Russia's entry into Ukraine contributed to widespread spread of false news and political myths.

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
sna: Chikwata ichi chinorwira kodzero dzekutapwa kwenhau chakati zvachaona patsvakurudzo dzayo zvinoshungurudza, nekuti anoratidza mikaha yekusawirirana yakadzika chose pakati pemapoka anotapa nhau mukati menyika imwe neimwe, uye pakati penyikawo dzakasiyana siyana pasi rose.
mt0: The group which advocates for the rights of press reporting said that what it would see in its investigations is disturbing, because it shows a very deep gap between the press reporting organizations in each country and across the world.

en: In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new, said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA.
sna: Muna 2022, hazvirambike kuti kusawirirana pamaonero nekumisidzana kwezvikwata zvekutapwa kwenhau nemvongamupopoto mukufambiswa kwemashoko ndizvo zviri kusundira mberi kusawirirana kwevanhu pamagariro avo nenzira itsva, akadaro Clayton Weimers, mutevedzeri wemukuru we RSF mudunhu reUnited States, achiudza VOA.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
sna: Akati kuwanda kwenhau dzinotsigira divi rimwe chete pasi rose kuri kuuraya kutapwa nekuturwa kwenhau dzechokwadi.
mt0: He said that the spread of false news around the world is killing the cure and the spread of true news.

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism.
sna: Mashoko eboka iri ezvinoitika gore negore anoisa pachikero nyika dzine zana nemakumi masere zvichienderana nekuti vanotapa nhau vakazvimirira vanotenderwa kushanda mumamiriro ezvinhu akaita sei.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
sna: Asi gore rino, RSF yakati yakashandisa nzira itsva inosanganisira mamiriro ezvematongerwo, zvemitemo, zvehupfumi zvemagariro netsika uye zvekuchengetedzwa nekuzvidzivirira.
mt0: But this year, RSF said it used a new approach which included political, legal, economic, social and cultural situations and protection and safety.

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom."
sna: Iyezvino, chikero ichi chinoisa kekutanga zvachisati chamboita nyika makumi maviri nesere "dzine rusununguko rwezvenhau rwakaipisisa".
mt0: Now, the site makes it the first time that it has ever done to describe 28 countries as "the worst freedom of information".

en: That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
sna: Chikwata ichi chinosanganisira China iyo yavakugovera kurambidza kufambiswa kwenhau nemashoko mhiri kwemiganhu yayo apawo ichiwedzera dzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzine manyepo uye dzakarerekera kudivi rimwe chete dzinobva kuKremlin pamusoro pehondo yeRussia iyo yaparadza nekusakadza nyika yeUkraine.
mt0: The group includes China which has blocked the circulation of news and information abroad and has added false political arguments and arguments from the Kremlin about the war which has destroyed and destroyed Ukraine.

en: Russia, China among worst
sna: Russia, China dziri pakati chenyika dzakaipisisa
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Russia, China are among the worst countries.

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
sna: Kubva zvayapinda neganyavhu muUkraine musi wa24 Kukdazi, Russia yakabva yabvupa masimba ese pamusoro pekuti nhau dzinobuda nedzisingabude ndedzipi, ichibva yamisa mutemo mutsva une chitarafu chemakore gumi nemashanu mujeri kune anenge apomerwa kunyora kunyora kana kutepfenyura mashoko anonzi "nhau dzenhema pamusor pemauto uye kurambidza kuti zviri kuitika muUkraine inzi "ihondo."
mt0: Since the invasion of Ukraine on 24 February, Russia has given up all powers over what rumors are published and published, which has created a new penalty of 15 years for those who publish or transmit rumors about the military and ban the military's actions in Ukraine as "war."

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
sna: Izvi zvabva zvamanikidza makambani ezvenhau akazvimiririra mazhinji anga achiri kushanda muRussia , anosanganisira bepanhau rine mukurumbira rinonzi Novaya Gazeta, newspaper, nhepfenyuroyeradio yeEkho Moskvy ne nhepfenyuro yemadzangaradzimu ye Dozhd TV, kuti avhare kana kuti abude muRussia kuti agone achiita basa.
mt0: This forced many independent media companies that were still working in Russia to close or leave the country to continue their work. These included the popular newspaper Novaya Gazeta, the newspaper, the radio station Ekho Moskvy and the spiritual television channel Dozhd TV.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
sna: Nyanzvi dzinoti zvapaisisna mazwi ezve nhau asina divi raakarerekera, hurumende yekuRussia yabva yatutira dzidziso yezvematongerwo ine manyepo uye yakarerekera kudivi rimwe chete inoti hondo iyi kunongova kusawirirana kudiki nekupa zvikonzero zvenhema zvinoruramisira kupinda kweRussia muUkraine neganyavhu.
mt0: Experts say that after a series of false reports, Russia's government turned back to a political doctrine and turned to one side which says that the war is just a small conflict and that Russia is simply refusing to accept the Ukrainian border.

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
sna: Nekuda kwekudzvanyirira kwainoita zvekutapwa kwenhau Russia iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi mashanu neshanu pakati pezvinhanho zana nemakumi masere dziri pachikero cheRSF, apo inenge iri pachinhanho chekutanga ndiyo inenge yakanyanya kusununguka uye nyika inenge iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi masere ndieye nyika inenge yakashatisisa.
mt0: Russia is fifty-sixth in the rankings of the RSF, where the first is the most free and the fifty-sixth is the most dangerous.

en: It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia, Clayton said.
sna: Nepatasvika, tingati hedu pasina kupokana kuti, kusunguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau dzangovangano dzematakadya kare, Clayton akadaro.
mt0: When we get here, we can all agree that the freedom of reporting of the events we've been eating has been a huge advantage, Clayton said.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
sna: Akatizve, mumakore makumi maviri nemaviri mutungamiriri weRussia Vladimir Putin achitonga, Moscow yanga yakangosona vatapi venhau nemasangano enhau asina divi raakarerekera.
mt0: Again, he said, in the 20 years of Vladimir Putin's rule, Moscow had only allowed journalists and newspapers to operate without a political interference.

en: But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia, Clayton said.
sna: Asi kubva Russia yapinda neganyavhu muUkraine, zvinoita sekuti Putin abva akohovedza masangano enhau akazvimiririra muRussia, Clayton akadaro.
mt0: But since Russia has invaded Ukraine, it seems that Putin has already destroyed independent media in Russia, Clayton said.

en: "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
sna: "Parizvino, hazvichagoni kuti pave nekutapa nekutura nhau nemazvo pamusoro pehondo yemu Ukraine."
mt0: Now, it is not possible to capture and spread accurate information about the war in Ukraine.

en: And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
sna: Zvino zvayakunyatsotongwa neChina, Hong Kong yakadonha zvine mutsindo, ichibva yamhara pachinhanho chezana nemakumi mana nesere mushure menguva yakareba yekuronda, kupindira mudzimba nekusunga zvakavhara madariro epadandemutande enhau anorwira gutsaruzhinji.
mt0: However, when China took over, Hong Kong fell sharply, ending in the fifties after a long period of violence, arson and occupation that closed down the broadcasts of democracy-building newspapers.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention.

en: President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime, RSF's country file states.

In other parts of the Asia-Pacific region, political uncertainty, fighting and democracy have driven away the entire period of peace and prosperity.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile.
sna: Kutorwa nechisimba chemauto hutongi hwemuMyanmar muna 2021, kwakabva kwamisa zvakanaka zvayitika mune zvekutapwa kwenhau kwemakore gumi, kuchibva kwatanga kusingwa kwevatapi venhau, marezinesi nemvumo dzekushanda kwemasangano enhau zvichibvarurwa nemasangano mazhinji enhau emuMyanamar chitiza munyika achinoshandira ari kunze.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. The military's capture of Myanmar's government in 2021, has ended the successful coverage of the news for 10 years, beginning the suspension of journalists, licenses and permission for reporting organizations, which many Myanmar news organizations have taken to leave the country to work abroad.

en: Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.

en: UN's Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
sna: Mukuru weUN Guterres Anosangana Nevakuru VeNigeria Mushure Mekushanyira Dunhu Risina Kugadzikana ReBorno State

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa.
sna: Munyori mukuru weU.N. Antonio Guterres akasangana nevatungamiriri vemuNigeria neChitatu pakapera kushanya kwake kwemazuva maviri kuNigeria nerwendo rwemazuva matatu kuAfrica.
mt0: The United Nations Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders on Tuesday after his two-day visit to Nigeria and a three-day tour of Africa.

en: On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes.
sna: NeChipiri, akashanyira vanhu vakabviswa kubva kumisha yavo muNigeria vanonzi Internally Displaced People (IDPs) kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva eNigeria akataura kuti vadzoserwe kumisha yavo nenzira yakachengetedzeka.
mt0: On Tuesday, he visited the Internally Displaced People (IDPs) in the north of Nigeria and spoke to the eastern Nigerians urging them to return to their villages safely.

en: Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.
sna: Vakuru memuNigeria vanehurongwa hwekuvhara  misasa inogara vanhu vakabviswa kumisha yavo mumakore mashoma onouya kunyangwe paine kutyira kuchengetedzeka kwevanhu ava pavanodzokera kumisha yavo.
mt0: The Nigerian government has a plan to close prisons for those who have been expelled from their villages in the coming years despite fears about their security when they return to their villages.

en: Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
sna: Antonio Guterres aakasvika kuimba yeUnited Nations muAbuja nenguva dzepfumbamwe mangwananni eChitatu akasangana vevanotungamiririra mune zvinoitwa neU.N. munzvimbo dzakasiyana siyana dzeNigeria pedzezvo ndookuzoita nhaurirano vevamiririri vevhanhukadzi vemuNigeria.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Antonio Guterres arrived at the United Nations headquarters in Abuja at 8:30 a.m. on Tuesday to meet with U.N. representatives in Nigeria and to hold a meeting with Nigerian women's representatives.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
sna: akokwa vakauya kumusangano uyu, vachitungamirirwa negurukota rezvemadzimayi muNigeria, Amai Pauline Kedem Tallen, vakakurukura nemunyori mukuru weU.N. nyaya yekuenzanisira pakati pemadzimayi nevarume, nekupinzwawo kwemadzimayi mune zvematongerwo.
mt0: The invitations came to the meeting, led by the Nigerian Women's Minister, Pauline Kedem Tallen, who spoke to the UN Secretary General about the equality between women and men, and the inclusion of women in politics.

en: His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws, said Tallen.
sna: Kuuya kwavo kuNigeria nhasi kwatipa tariro,  nekuti tinoziva kuti achatipawo inzwi rake kunyaya dzose dzinobata vanhukadzi, kubatwa neganyavhu kuitwa vanhukadzi, kuroorwa vachiri vanana, kuishandiswa kwemimwe mitemo, akadaro Tallen.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. His visit to Nigeria today gave us hope, because we know that he will also speak to all issues affecting women, including rape of women, child marriage, and other laws, said Tallen.

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
sna: Mushure mazvo, Guterres akazoonanan nevatungamiriri vezvezvinamato vemuNigeria mushure mazvo akaenda pachiitiko chekuisa maruva echirangaridzo pamaba yeU.N. kuyeuka vanhu makumi maviri nevatatu vakaurayiwa pakakandwa mabhabhu mukati meimba iyi muna2011.
mt0: After that, Guterres met with Nigerian religious leaders after he attended a ceremony to commemorate the twenty-three people killed in the bombing of the United Nations building in 2011.

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
sna: Akatanga rwendo rwake kunyika nhatu dzemuAfrica musi weSvondo ari muSenegal sechikamu cherwendo rwekuratidza kutsigira kwake mwaka weRamadan, mushure mazvo ndookuzoenda kuNiger.
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know. He began his trip to three African countries on Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan support tour, then went to Niger.

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
sna: Nechipiri akashanyira dunhu riri kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva reBorno uko akasangana nemtungamiriri wedunhu iri, uyewo nevanhu vakabvuswa kumisha yavo pamwenehondo nemhuri dzavo nekuda kwehondo yeBoko Haram.
mt0: When he visited the southern region of Borno, he met with the governor and the people who were allowed back to their villages by the Boko Haram fighting.

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
sna: Guterres akashanyirawo varwi veBoko Haram vakatendeuka uye akarumbidza basa riri kuitwa nevatungamiriri kuburikidza nechirongwa chekudzosera vaimbova varwi ava vanodarika chiuru kuti mudzimhuri nemisha yavo.
mt0: Guterres also visited Boko Haram militants who have been reunited and praised the work of the government to repatriate more than 1,000 of the former fighters back to their families and homes.

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.
sna: Vakarumbidzawo basa riri kuitwa vevakuru rekudzosera kumisha vanhu vakange vatiza matunhu avo nekuda kwehondo vakakumbirawo kuti pave nekuwedzera rubatsiro rwekuvaka zvakare dunhu iri.
mt0: They also praised the work of the authorities to repatriate the people who had fled their homes because of the war and asked for more aid to rebuild the country.

en: "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said.
sna: "Borno yandaona nhasi iBorno ine taririro, Borno ine ramangwana, uye ndafadzwa chose kuona chirongwa chiri kushandiswa kuno, nekuti makaona kuti hamurwise hugandanga nezvombo zvehondo zvoga, asi kuti munorwisa hungandanga nekukudzura midzi nezvikonzero zvehugandanga," akadaro.
mt0: "Borno I saw today is Borno with hope, Borno with a future, and I was very happy to see the program being used here, because you have seen that you don't just fight bandits with weapons, but that you fight bandits by cutting roots and causes of bandits," he said.

en: "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity.
sna: "Vanhu vandasangana navo nhasi mumisasa yemaIDP vanoda kudzokera kumusha nenzira yakachengetedzeka uye inoremekedza hunhu hwavo.
mt0: "The people we met today in the IDP camp want to return home safely and respectfully.

en: The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
sna: Nzira yekugadzirisa hugandanga nenzira inogarahaingosanganisiri kupa tariro asi ramangwana rezvinhu zvinobatika."
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know The way to solve the crisis is not giving hope but a future that is interesting."

en: But in recent months it has moved ahead with reforms that analysts say could make its courts function more like others in the Middle East.

sna: Basa iri rese rakatsamhira pane mudungwe wemitemo mitsva inobata nyaya dzinozezesa kutaura nezvadzo dzakaita sekodzero dzemadzimayi mushure mekunge vambana nevarume vavo uyewo nemasimba evatongi vedzimhosva kuti vatare zvirango munyaya dzekunge vanhu vatyora mutemo.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.

mt0: However, experts are willing to accept that these changes could lead to a reduction in the number of cases where judicial authorities in Saudi Arabia are able to enforce laws.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.

en: As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region, said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.

en: I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story, the 42-year-old journalist said.

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
sna: Sancha akaberekerwa nekukura kuAndalusia kuchamhembe kweSpain, asi ndokuzopedza makore guymi nemana ari mudunhu reMiddle East achinyora nhau dzehondo muIraq, Syria neYemen, achinyora nhau dzacho ari kuEgypt, Lebanon Tunisia.

en: For so much of American history, the church has really been or their congregations have really been essential, providing an unheralded role in providing cohesion and connectedness in communities encouraging civic engagement and political participation, says Daniel Cox, director of the Survey Center on American Life and a senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute.
sna: Munhorondo zhinji yeAmerica, kereke kana kuti zvaunga zvemakereke, zvakange zvakakosha zviita basa risina vamwe vakamboriita rekuunza kubatana nemidzi yehukama munzvimbo dzigere vanhu, kukurudzira kuti vagari vemunzvimbo vapinzwa muhurongwa hwunobata hupenyu hwavo uye nekuridzira vagri kuti kuti vave nechekuita mune zvematongerwo, anodaro Daniel Cox, mukuru we Survey Center on American Life nemunzveri mukuru weAmerican Enterprise Institute.
mt0: In the history of America, churches or religious organizations have played a very important role in bringing together communities with roots of friendship and relationships, encouraging the participation of the local residents in a sustainable planning system and encouraging the participation of the local residents in politics, says Daniel Cox, chief executive of the Survey Center on American Life and a fellow of the American Enterprise Institute.

en: It was not happenstance or luck that the civil rights movement emerged out of the church, Cox says.

en: Churches and other houses of worship have also played a role in helping immigrants assimilate once they arrive in America, Cox says.

en: Third places  Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist Ray Oldenburg dubbed as "third places" public gathering spots that offer something that home, the "first place," and work, the "second place," might not.
sna: Nzvimbo Dzechitatu Kusabatana kana kuva nenhengo yemakereke, ma mosques nema synagogue zvinoreva kuti vanhu vanenge vachirasikirwa neizvo zvinonzi nenyanzvi inoongorora magariro netsika dzemumadhorobha,Ray Oldenburg, akadaidza kuti "nzvimbo dzechitatu" nzvimbo dziendwa neveruzhinji dzinopa munhu chimwe chinhu chekuti chaasingapihwe kumba inova "nzvimbo yekutanga" nekubasa inova "nzvimbo yechipiri".
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Third places. Third places are places where people go to get something they can't get at home, which is "first place" and work is "second place".

en: Oldenburg argued that third places are critical to a communitys social vitality.

mt0: Oldenburg says these third areas are important in bringing health to the environment of the people who live there.

en: If you're a regular at a cafe, the barista may know what you usually order, and they can make it for you, and that feels good, says clinical psychologist Dr. Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.
sna: Kana uri munhu anosienda panzvimbo inotengeswa svutugadzike, mubuki wesvutugadzike anogona kunge ava kutoziva kuti unotenga rudzi ipi yacho, uye izvi zvinoita kuti munhu anzwe zvakanaka, anodaro anoona chiremba nezvehutano hwemanzwiro nekufunga kwevanhu, Dr. Maria Espinola, uyo ari muzvinafundo mubazi rinodzidzisa zvehutano hwepfungwa nehunhu nemaitiro evanhu reDepartment of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience paUniversity of Cincinnati College of Medicine.

en: It feels good to be recognized, to know that people are expecting you, to know that people care about you, to know that you belong, because the need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways, Espinola says.
sna: Espinola anoti, "Zvinoita kuti munhu anzwe zvakanaka maari kana vanhu vakamuziva kuti ndiani, kuziva kuti vanhu vakakutarisira kuti usvike,  kuziva kuti vanhu vane hanya newe, kuziva kuti unkowo kwaunoti ndekwangu, nekuti chishuvo chekuva nekunonzi nemunhu ndiko kwake kune nekwake vaanoyanana nekudyidzana navo chinhu chakakosha chinodiwa nesu tese zvaedu, uye zvakakosha kuti chazadzikiswa nenzira dzakasiya."

en: According to the survey, other top concerns for Americas mayors include the financial insecurity of low-income residents (33%), the closing of small businesses (29%) and increased crime and violence (26%).

About one-fifth of the chiefs of these cities are concerned about the issue of workers working from remote locations using telephones and internet and that the worst will come after a few years when they will be moving to other cities.

en: The $350 billion in funding from the American Rescue Plan to local and state governments could help mayors address some of their concerns.

en: The survey found that 78% of mayors believe the money will allow them to make meaningful change.

en: What we're seeing is a large majority are using it for things they consider to be transformative and will make major changes to their cities, Glick says, "instead of feeling obligated or feeling the necessity to use it to plug up over-budget gaps to keep the doors open and the lights on."

en: Young Compete Against Old in Hottest US Rental Market in a Decade

en: It's not just about millennials, it's not just about [Gen] Z [people under 24], we also see that boomers are making a transition, he added.

en: Some medical experts have expressed concern that COVID-19 preventative measures, like masking and remote schooling, are potentially weakening childrens immune systems by shielding them from the usual childhood illnesses.

en: There are a lot of reasons to believe that kids need to be exposed to things to keep their immunity complex, so that should they encounter something very dangerous, they have aspects of their immunity that might cross over and help protect them against those things, says Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.

en: At birth, vulnerable infants get antibodies from their mothers breast milk, which helps protect them until they can build their own immunity.

en: So, some people would argue that childhood illnesses, like colds and stomach bugs, build our immunity so that when more dangerous things come along, we're prepared and we don't get as sick from those more dangerous things.
sna: Saka, vamwe vanogona kuzoti zvirwere zvevana vadiki, zvakaita sedzihwa nemudumbu, zvinovaka masoja anotidzivirira kuitira kuti kana zvimwe zvhinhu zvine njodzi zvikazouya, tinenge takagadzirira uye hatizonyanye kurwara nekuda kwezvinhu izvi zvine njodzi.

sna: Gurukota rezvemutemo muRwanda vakati hurumende yavo iri kuafdzwa nekusungwa nemusi weMuvhuro kweaimbove mukuru wevapunduki achipomerwa mhosva you kuronga kupondwa kwevanhu vazhinjisa  uye kutyora kodzero dzevanhu vekuRwanda nekuCongo muna 1994.
mt0: The Rwandan justice minister said the government is being threatened by the arrest of a former chief of the armed forces accused of planning to kill hundreds of people and violating the rights of the people of Rwanda and Congo in 1994.

en: French authorities arrested Callixte Mbarushimana, a former leader of the infamous Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR), an ethnic Hutu rebel group.
sna: Vakuru vekuFrance vakasunga Callixte Mbarushimana, uyo akambove mukuru wechikwata chaive chevanhu verudzi rwechiHutu chaive nembiri yehun'an'a, chainzi Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).
mt0: French officials arrested Callixte Mbarushimana, who was once the head of the Hutu nationalist group Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR).

en: Tharcisse Karugarama welcomed the decision of French authorities to enforce the international arrest warrant issued by his government and the International Criminal Court (ICC) against the former rebel leader.
sna: Tharcisse Karugarama wakagamuchira zvakaitwa nevakuru vekuFrance kushandisa masimba echikumbiro chekuti akambove mutungamiriri wevapanduki uyu chero kunyika kwaanenge abatwa ari chakaiswa nehurumende yeRwanda nedare renyika zhinji dzepasi rose rinotonga nyaya dzehugeven'a.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Tharcisse Karugarama accepted the French authorities' requests to recognize the former leader of the rebels, which was submitted by the Rwandan government and the International Court of Justice.

en: It is good news that Callixte Mbarushimana has been (arrested) by the French judicial authority.
sna: Inhau dzakanaka idzi dzekuti Callixte Mbarushimana azosungwa nevanoona nezvemutemo vemuFrance.
mt0: This is a good news that Callixte Mbarushimana will be jailed by French authorities.

en: Good news in the sense that, first, there was an international arrest warrant against him issued by the Rwandan government in respect of (the alleged) act of genocide committed in Rwanda in 1994.
sna: Nhau dzakanaka nekuti, motsi, pakange paine chikumbiro chakaiswa kunyika dzese pamusoro pake kuti asungwe chakaiswa nehurumende yeRwanda nekuda kwepomerwa mhosva yekukonzeresa kupondwa kwevanhu vazhinjisa muRwanda muna 1994.
mt0: However, the good news is that, while he was still alive, there was a request to be released from prison by the Rwandan government because of the charges of genocide which led to the death of thousands of people in 1994.

en: Karugarama said the Hague-based court sought the arrest of the former rebel leader who was believed to be hiding in France.
sna: Karugarama akati dare redzimhosva iro rinemuzinda waro muHague, kuSwitzerland, rakaronga kusungwa kweuyu aimbove mukuru wevapanduki aifungidzirwa kuti akange akahwanda muFrance.
mt0: Karugarama said the judicial body which has its headquarters in Hague, Switzerland, had decided to extradite the former leader of the revolutionary movement who was suspected of having fled to France.

en: Genocide memorial in Rwanda

en: The International Criminal Court (ICC) conducted its own investigation about his other activities and they found sufficient evidence to support the charge of war crimes and crimes against humanity perpetrated in the DRC and they issued an arrest warrant, which the French judicial authorities have executed.
sna: Dare renyika zhinji dzepasi rose rinoongorora kuparwa kwemhosva dzehugeven'a reInternational Criminal Court (ICC) rakaferefeta rega pamusoro pemamwe mabasa ake uye rikawana humbowo hwakakwana hunotsigira kupomerwa kwake mhosva dzehondo dzaakapara uye nemhosva dzehugeven'a pamusoro pevanhu dzakaparwa munyika yeDRC, naizvozvo vakatura chikumbiro chekusungwa kwake, icho vakuru vemuFrance vakazozadzikisa.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The Hague-based court accused Mbarushimana and other rebels in the FDLR of using violence against unarmed civilians as their main tool in a campaign to forcefully obtain political power for the rebel group.
sna: Dare iri rine muzinda waro muHague rakapomera Mbarushimana nevamwe vapanduki veFDLR kushandisa chisimba chaikuvadza vagariwo zvavo vakange vasina zvombo senzira yavo huru yekuedza kuti vawanire boka revavapanduki iri masimba ezvematongorwo enyika.
mt0: The court which has its headquarters in Hague has accused Marxman and other FDLR rebels of using violence against their civilians as a major means of trying to find the politically active group.

en: According to the ICC, "as a result of this deadly blackmail (by the FDLR rebels), victims were killed, raped, and forcibly displaced, and entire villages were razed to the ground."
sna: Zvichienderana nezvakaturwa ne ICC, "nekuda kwekuedza kuwana zvavaida nehukoronyera nechikiribidi zvakaitwa  nevapanduki veFDLR, vanhu vakaurayiwa, vakabatwa chibharo, kumanikidzwa kuti vatize kwavaigara uye misha yakaparadzwa ikasiiwa rangova ivhu."
mt0: According to the ICC, "in order to obtain what they wanted with the violence and graphic displays of the FDLR rebels, those killed, taken hostage, forced to flee their homes, and those destroyed houses were left to be a land."

en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
sna: Karugarama akati Mbarushimana nemasoja ake evapanduki veFDLR vakaita chikamu chikuru mukuurayiwa kwevanhu vazhinji munyika muna 1994 apo zviuru zvemazana evanhu vakapondwa.
mt0: Karugarama said that Barushimana and his FDLR troops were a major part of the killing of thousands of people in 1994 when thousands of people were killed.

en: We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC.
sna: Tinotenda kuti, mumasvondo mashoma ari kutevera, mushure mekunge zvese zvinifanirwa kutevedzerwa pamutemo zvaitwa muFrance,  achange achitamiswa kuenda ku The Hague kuNetherlands kuti anozvidavirira mhosva dzaari kupomerwa agochichiswa nemhosva dzehondo nemhosva dzekukuvadza nekuuraya vanhu dzaakaparwa munyika yeDRC.
mt0: We hope that, in the coming weeks, after all the necessary procedures have been taken in France, he will be taken to The Hague in the Netherlands to answer his charges and face genocide and murder charges in the DRC.

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
sna: Gurukota rezvemutemo iri rakatiwo Rwanda ichange ibatirana neInternational Criminal Courtmukuchuchiswa nekukurumidza kwaMbarushimana.
mt0: The Rwandan justice minister said that the country would cooperate with the International Criminal Court in the case of the Rwandan prisoner.

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-33
sna: Makurukota Ezvekunze ekuBritain neFrance Vchakuchidzira Basa Rekuunza Runyararo MuDRC
mt0: The British and French Foreign Ministers will encourage the work of peacekeeping in the DRC.

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
sna: Makurukota Ezvekunze ekuBritain neFrance ari kuenda kuDemocratic Republic of Congo neMuvhuro vachitanga kushana kwemazuva matatu kunyika ina dziri mudunhu risina kugadzikana reCentral Africa.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. The British and French Foreign Ministers are going to Democratic Republic of Congo on Monday to begin a three-day visit to four countries in the Central African region.

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
sna: Rwendo rebasa uru rwuchange rwuchitungamirirwa negurukota rezvekunze kweBritain Jack Straw neanoita basa rimwechetero kuFrance Hubert Vedrine.
mt0: If you can't translate this simply say you don't know.

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
sna: Vachange vachishanyira Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi neUganda.
mt0: They will visit the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
sna: Chinangwa chavo chikuru kufemera hupenyu hutsva kubasa rekuunza runyararo kunyika yasakadzwa nehondo yeCongo.
mt0: The main goal is to breathe life into the work of bringing peace to a country that has been destroyed by the war in Congo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
sna: Chikuru kuru, Britain neFrance dziri kuda kubviswa mauto ekunedzimwe nyika anotsigira hurumende DRC) nekuisiswa zvombo pasi kwevapanduki avo vanotonga chikamu chiri pakati nepakati chenyika uye ne nhaurirano dzerunyararo kuti dzipedze gakava nehondo.
mt0: The main objective is to remove the troops from other countries (including the DRC) and to negotiate peace talks to end the conflict.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
sna: Gurukota rezvekunze muBritain Straw akati rwendo rwebasa urwu rwaivawo nedonzvo guru rekuona kuti Congo haizove imwe nyika yakasakadzwa nehondo nevapunduki seAfghanistan.
mt0: The British Foreign Secretary Straw said the visit was also a major step towards making Congo not a war zone like Afghanistan.

en: The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states, he said.
sna: Zuva remusi wa 11th Gunyana (apo nyika yeAmerica yakarwiswa nevanhu vakapfeka mabhomhu vanhu vazhinji vakaurayiwa zvivakwa zvikuru zvika wisirwa pasi) raita kuti zvikoshe zvikuru kuti titore matanhu nekukasira kuekugadzirisa nyika dzirikukonewa kana dzakatokonewa kukuzvotonga nenzira inounza runyararo nekugadzikana.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know The 11th of September (when the United States was attacked by armed gangs where many people were killed and buildings were destroyed) makes it very important to take steps quickly to resolve nations that are weak or weaker to govern them in a way that brings peace and stability.

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila.
sna: MuKinshasa, makurukota aya achasangana nemutungamiriri weCongo Joseph Kabila.
mt0: In Kinshasa, the Cabinet will meet with the President of Congo Joseph Kabila.

en: He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
sna: Akapinda pachigaro gore rakapera, mushure mekunge baba vake, President Laurent Kabila, apfurwa akafa nemumwe wechengetedzi vavo.
mt0: He was elected last year after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was shot dead by a security guard.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
sna: Vabva uku vachazoenda kuKigali kunota hurukuro nemutungamiriri weRwanda, President Paul Kagame, nemutungamiriri webato revapanduki reCongolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
mt0: They will then go to Kigali to meet with the President of Rwanda, Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Democratic Party of Congo, Adolphe Onusumba.

sna: Makurukota aya achashanya kwenguva pfupi kuBurundi kuti vanokurukura nemutungamiriri wayo Pierre Buyoya pamusoro pehondo yekusawirirana kwezvizvarwa zvemo.
